TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed ClassInterfaceType extends System.Enum

summary.span: Identifies the type of class interface that is generated for a class.

span.span: Identifies the type of class interface that is generated for a class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Essa enumeração é usada em conjunto com o atributo.This enumeration is used in conjunction with the attribute. ## Examples Este exemplo mostra como aplicar o para um tipo de configuração de .This example shows how to apply the to a type, setting the . Classes definidas dessa maneira podem ser usados em COM. não gerenciadoClasses defined this way can be used from unmanaged COM. MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType AutoDispatch = int32(1)

summary.span: Indicates that the class only supports late binding for COM clients.

span.span: Indicates that the class only supports late binding for COM clients.

summary.span: A for the class is automatically exposed to COM clients on request.

span.span: A for the class is automatically exposed to COM clients on request.

summary.span: The type library produced by [Tlbexp.exe (Type Library Exporter)](~/docs/framework/tools/tlbexp-exe-type-library-exporter.md) does not contain type information for the in order to prevent clients from caching the DISPIDs of the interface.

span.span: The type library produced by [Tlbexp.exe (Type Library Exporter)](~/docs/framework/tools/tlbexp-exe-type-library-exporter.md) does not contain type information for the in order to prevent clients from caching the DISPIDs of the interface.

summary.span: The does not exhibit the versioning problems described in because clients can only late-bind to the interface.

span.span: The does not exhibit the versioning problems described in because clients can only late-bind to the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Essa é a configuração padrão para .This is the default setting for .

summary.span: Indicates that a dual class interface is automatically generated for the class and exposed to COM.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType None = int32(0)

summary.span: Indicates that no class interface is generated for the class.

span.span: Indicates that no class interface is generated for the class.

summary.span: If no interfaces are implemented explicitly, the class can only provide late-bound access through the interface.

span.span: If no interfaces are implemented explicitly, the class can only provide late-bound access through the interface.

summary.span: This is the recommended setting for .

span.span: This is the recommended setting for .

summary.span: Using is the only way to expose functionality through interfaces implemented explicitly by the class.

span.span: Using is the only way to expose functionality through interfaces implemented explicitly by the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [TlbExp.exe (exportador da biblioteca)](~/docs/framework/tools/tlbexp-exe-type-library-exporter.md) expõe a primeira interface pública, COM visível implementada pela classe como a interface padrão de coclass.[Tlbexp.exe (Type Library Exporter)](~/docs/framework/tools/tlbexp-exe-type-library-exporter.md) exposes the first public, COM-visible interface implemented by the class as the default interface of the coclass. Começando com o .NET Framework versão 2.0, você pode especificar a interface padrão exposto ao COM usando o atributo.Beginning with the .NET Framework version 2.0, you can specify the default interface exposed to COM by using the attribute. Se a classe implementa interfaces não, a primeira interface pública, COM visível implementada por uma classe base torna-se a interface padrão (começando com a classe base derivada mais recentemente e trabalhando para trás).If the class implements no interfaces, the first public, COM-visible interface implemented by a base class becomes the default interface (starting with the most recently derived base class and working backward). TlbExp.exe expõe `_Object` como interface padrão se nem a classe nem suas classes base implementam interfaces.Tlbexp.exe exposes `_Object` as the default interface if neither the class nor its base classes implement interfaces.
